scenario: Shares of Monster Beverage (MNST) rose 6.2% after a Q4 earnings report that beat Wall Street's consensus estimate by a small margin. Revenues grew 4.7% year over year to $1.81 billion, but earnings per share of $0.38 fell short of the $0.40 analyst target. Adjusted GAAP earnings fell 20% year over year to $0.28 per share due to $130.7 million of goodwill impairment charges related to disappointing results in the alcoholic brands segment. The flagship Monster brand posted 13.7% annual growth in the fourth quarter, boosting its energy drink market share from 29.3% to 30%. The company is launching its Beast product line overseas this summer, which could be a long-lived growth story or a dud.

1. **Asymmetric Regulatory Exposure:** EU caffeine rules create reformulation optionality (long HSKA's preservative tech vs short EU retail)
